dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model
Class Opt

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.Opt

public class Opt
extends java.lang.Object

This class stores the local options of a DCtxt object. Options are inhereited when the context creates new contexts. The options control how configuration nodes are accessed:

  • use node operations: If set to true so called node operations are used to manipulate nodes. Node operations are dispatched to a specific writer thread for processing and can be undone.
  • no schema: If set to true nodes that are not bound to a schema can also be accessed.
  • only existing: If set to true only existing nodes can be accessed
By default options need not be changed. When a context is handed into a Public API functionality the required options are already set.

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2008.a

INTERNAL_OPT_FORBID_CC_PRECOMPILE

@Deprecated
public static final int INTERNAL_OPT_FORBID_CC_PRECOMPILE
Deprecated. Only for internal use
If this is set, an attempt to access parameters or references with the config class PreCompile will lead to an error.

Note that the restriction will be applied, no matter if configuration class awareness is enabled or not!

WARNING: Shall not be set by the user! Changing these options might allow to access parameters which are not set yet in this context!

Since:
13.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

WARNING: This method should not be used for users of the Public API as changes to this flag and not reseting severely changes the functionality of other applications using the Public API.

setNoSchema

public boolean setNoSchema(boolean noSchema)
Changes the no schema option.

Parameters:
noSchema - true to also accept DataNodes without a schema (OPT_NO_SCHEMA)
Returns:
true (always)
Since:
2008.a

getNoSchema

public boolean getNoSchema()
This option is set when running with a model for which a schema does no exist which is the case when manipulating data that comes from an importer and must be adjusted to the actual configuration structure. This option normally need not to be changed manually as it is already set when the context is created.

Returns:
true if API also accepts DataNodes without a schema (OPT_NO_SCHEMA)
Since:
2008.a

getExistingNodesOnly

public boolean getExistingNodesOnly()
Existing nodes are nodes that are not disabled by the ENABLE attribute.

Returns:
true if the context can be set only to existing nodes and only existing nodes are returned ( OPT_ONLY_EXISTING)

setExistingNodesOnly

public boolean setExistingNodesOnly(boolean existing)
                             throws CtxtException
Enable/Disable the feature to only accept existing nodes for a context and only return existing contexts. ( OPT_ONLY_EXISTING). Existing nodes are nodes that are enabled, e.g. by the ENABLE attribte.

Beware:

If this option is set to false, then the return values from evaluting XPath expressions inside DCtxt context may differ from evaluating the same XPath expression within template based code generator. This only occurs when trying to access disabled nodes in the XPath expression.

Parameters:
existing - Enable feature
Returns:
true if enabling/disabling suceeded (disable succeeded always, enable only if context node is existing)
Throws:
CtxtException - if context node is not existing
Since:
2008.a

setUseNodeOperations

public void setUseNodeOperations(boolean nodeOperations)
If setting this option to true all changes to the configuration are made by so called NodeOperations. When the user is configuring in parallel to the work of the public API (push services etc) all changes must use NodeOperations. NodeOperations can be undone by the user via the undo/redo buttons. Normally this options need not be changed as it is set to the correct value when the context is created.

Parameters:
nodeOperations - set to true to use the NodeOperation interface which provides Undo and Redo support to modify the DataModel (OPT_USE_NODE_OPERATION)
Since:
2008.a

getUseNodeOperations

public boolean getUseNodeOperations()
If this option is set to true all changes to the configuration are made by so called NodeOperations. When the user is configuring in parallel to the work of the public API (push services etc) all changes must use NodeOperations. NodeOperations can be undone by the user via the undo/redo buttons.

Returns:
true if NodeOperations are used to manipulate the DataModel (OPT_USE_NODE_OPERATION)
Since:
2008.a
